document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Luiz Fernando M. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.masterDocTitle: The spider genus Patrera Simon (Araneae: Dionycha, Anyphaeninae) in the Atlantic Forest biome, with the description of one new species from Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The spider genus Patrera Simon (Araneae: Dionycha, Anyphaeninae) in the Atlantic Forest biome, with the description of one new species from Brazil

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Programa de Pós-Graduação em Zoologia, Instituto de Biociências de São Paulo, Rua do Matão, 14, 05508 - 090, Universidade de São Paulo, São Paulo, SP, Brazil. & Laboratório de Coleções Zoológicas, Instituto Butantan, Av. Vital Brasil, 1500, 05503 - 900, São Paulo, SP, Brazil.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Anyphaena longipes
Keyserling, 1891: 91
, figs 53–53a ( Syntypes , one male from Rio Grande ( 32°2’6”S ; 52°5’56”W ), Rio Grande do Sul , Brazil , von Ihering leg., deposited in BMNH 1890.7.1.624 and five females and one loose male palp, from Nova Friburgo, Rio de Janeiro , Brazil , deposited in BMNH 1890.7.1.625-628, all examined. Lectotype male in BMNH 1890.7.1.624 and paralectotypes in BMNH 1890.7.1.625-628 here designated).

Teudis itatiayae Mello-Leitão, 1915: 139
( Holotype female from Retiro [Retiro do Ramos, Parque Nacional do Itatiaia, circa 2200 m ], Itatiaia, Rio de Janeiro , Brazil , 1903, C. Moreira leg., deposited in MNRJ 182, examined, lost in the 2018 fire);
Silva-Moreira et al. , 2010: 13
. New synonymy .

Sillus delicatus Mello-Leitão, 1922: 35
( Syntypes male and female from Pinheiro (currently Piraí, Pinheiral), C.F. de Mello- Leitão leg., deposited in the MNRJ 654, examined, lost in the 2018 fire);
Silva-Moreira et al. , 2010: 12
. New synonymy .

Sillus spinifrons Mello-Leitão, 1926: 11
, fig 11 ( Syntypes two females from Caxambú, Minas Gerais , Brazil , C.F. de Mello- Leitão leg., deposited in the MNRJ 665, not examined, lost);
Silva-Moreira et al. , 2010: 3
(Syn.).

Patrera longipes : Brescovit, 1997: 33
;
Silva-Moreira et al. , 2010: 3
, 12.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Synonymy. The loose palp, here considered as a male paralectotype , corresponds to that of the lectotype . Despite the distance between the records, there are females from the same location, confirming co-specificity. In relation to the synonymies, the description of Mello-Leitão (1922) points out that
Sillus delicatus
has a curved black crossbeam in the middle of the abdomen, which folds to the anterior region at the ends, in two short longitudinal branches. This same band occurs ventrally in the abdomen of
Teudis itatiayae
and in
Patrera longipes
(both types examined), allowing the synonymy between these three species.

Other material examined.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4A–G.
Patrera longipes ( Keyserling, 1891 )
. Male (IBSP 140062): A habitus, dorsal view; C left palp, ventral view; D same, retrolateral view; E same, dorsal view. Female (IBSP 122416): B habitus, dorsal view; F epigynum, ventral view; G epigynum dorsal view. Abbreviations: CD, copulatory ducts; E, embolus; FD, fertilization ducts; H, hood; MA, median apophysis; RTA, retrolateral tibial apophysis; S, spermathecae; SR, seminal receptacles; ST, subtegulum; T, tegulum. Scale bars: A, B 3.5mm; C 0.66mm; D, F 0.73mm; F, G 0.25mm.

FIGURE 5A–D.
Patrera longipes ( Keyserling, 1891 )
. Male (MCN 7482): A left palp, ventral view; B same, retrolateral view (arrow: prolateral cymbial projection). Female (MCN 3576): C epigynum, ventral view; D epigynum, dorsal view. Abbreviations: A, atrium; CD, copulatory ducts; CO, copulatory opening; E, embolus; FD, fertilization ducts; H, hood; LB, lateral borders; MA, median apophysis; RTA, retrolateral tibial apophysis; S, spermathecae; SR, seminal receptacles; ST, subtegulum; T, tegulum. Scale bars: A–D 0.25mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Males of
Patrera longipes
are easily distinguished from the remaining species by the tibial retrolateral apophysis very large and rounded at tip with shovel-shaped, and by the conspicuous prolateral posterior cymbial projection ( Figs 4D, E , 5B , 6D–H ) in the male palp. Females are diagnosed by the broad atrium, wider than long, and by the triangular, large hood in the anterior area of the epigynal plate ( Figs 5C , 6I ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6A–I.
Patrera longipes ( Keyserling, 1891 )
. Male (IBSP 35038): A chelicerae, ventral view; B left palp, ventral view; C same, ventral view, retrolateral tibial apophysis, detail, ventral view; D same, retrolateral view (arrow: prolateral cymbial projection); E same, retrolateral view; F same, retrolateral view; G same, prolateral view; H same, dorsal view. Female (IBSP 122416): I epigynum, ventral view. Abbreviations: A, atrium; C; cymbium; CO, copulatory opening; E, embolus; H, hood; LB, lateral borders; MA, median apophysis; RTA, retrolateral tibial apophysis; ST, subtegulum; T, tegulum. Scale bars: A, B, E, H 0.3mm; C, F, I 0.2mm; D, G 0.5mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male ( Holotype ). Carapace orange. Chelicerae brown yellowish, labium and endites orange. Sternum orange, with dark borders. Legs yellowish orange. Abdomen dorsally brownish, ventrally grayish cream, with dark gray band transversely at the median region (close to the tracheal spiracle). Spinnerets whitish ( Fig. 4A ). Total length 5.5, carapace length 2.3, width 1.8. Clypeus height 0.08. Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.08, ALE 0.15, PME 0.15, PLE 0.15; AME–AME 0.05, AME–ALE 0.05, PME–PME 0.15, PME–PLE 0.12, ALE–PLE 0.07. Chelicerae 1.2 long, six promarginal teeth, four retromarginal denticles ( Fig. 6A ). Leg measurements: leg I—femur 3.6/ patella 1.1/ tibia 4.0/ metatarsus 3.35/ tarsus 1.35/ total 13.4; II—3.45/ 1.05/ 3.55/ 3.0/ 1.2/ 12.25; III—2.25/ 0.7/ 1.9/ 2.15/ 0.7/ 7.7; IV—3.5/ 0.9/ 3.3/ 3.4/ 1.2/ 12.3. Leg spination: I—II—tibia v2-2-0, p1-1-1, r1-1-1, metatarsus v2-1-0, p1-1-1, r1-1-1; III—IV—tíbia v2-2-2, p1-1-0, r1-1-0, metatarsus v2-2-2, p1-1-1, r1-1-1. Abdomen: length 3.25, epigastric furrow 2.05 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 2.35 from base of spinnerets. Palp: tibia as long as cymbium, slightly curved; cymbium with small ventral basal projection; oval tegulum, with sperm duct running along the basal border; tegular projection with rounded apex, prolaterally positioned; short, curved median apophysis; longitudinally grooved embolus, with prolateral origin, curved medially over the tegulum and projecting toward the apex of the cymbium ( Figs 4C , 5A , 6B, D, E ).

Female (BMNH 1890.7.1.625). Coloration as in male, except dorsal abdomen, lighter ( Fig. 4B ). Total length 7.4, carapace length 2.8, width 2.25. Clypeus height 0.06. Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.08, ALE 0.17, PME 0.17, PLE 0.17; AME–AME 0.05, AME–ALE 0.05, PME–PME 0.13, PME–PLE 0.12, ALE–PLE 0.06. Chelicerae 1.17 long, eight promarginal teeth, four retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: leg I—femur 4.1/ patella 1.15/ tibia 4.35/ metatarsus 3.65/ tarsus 1.6/ total 14.85; II—3.86/ 1.05/ 3.9/ 3.35/ 1.25/ 13.4; III—2.65/ 0.9/ 2.05/ 2.6/ 0.7/ 8.9; IV—3.9/ 1.1/ 3.5/ 3.9/ 1.1/ 13.5. Leg spination: I— II—tibia v2-2-0, p0, r0, metatarsus v2-0-0, p0, r0; III—tibia v2-2-0, p1-1-0, r1-1-0, metatarsus v2-2-2, p1-1-1, r1-1-1; IV—tibia v2-2-2, p1-1-0, r1-1-0, metatarsus v2-2-2, p1-1-1, r1-1-1. Abdomen: length 4.65, epigastric furrow 1.5 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 1.7 from base of spinnerets. Epigynum: lateral borders narrow, not connected distally, medially projected over the atrium; internally with long, coiled copulatory ducts; elongated seminal receptacles, in the proximal area of the copulatory ducts; reniform spermathecae; fertilization ducts as long as the spermathecae, curved, basal ( Figs 4F, G , 5C, D , 6I ).
Variation. Males (n=10): total length 5.5–7.5; carapace length 2.3–3.0; femur I length 3.6–5.2; Females (n=10): total length: 7.2–8.4; carapace length 2.7–3.2; femur I length 3.8–4.7.
Distribution . Midwest, Southeast and South of Brazil and Northeastern Argentina ( Fig. 27B ).
